alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 4:27PM CDT until April 24 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Denton County * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and water over roadways is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denton, Sanger, Celina, Krum, Pilot Point, Justin, Aubrey, Northlake, Krugerville, Cross Roads, New Fairview, Ray Roberts Park Isle Du Bois and Ponder.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
